definition.description: Stores all user posts in a global collection. Any authenticated user can read all posts, but can only create, update, or delete their own.

params.name: postId
params.description: The unique identifier for the post.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for a public, social-media-style application. User profiles are stored in a `/users` collection, while all posts are stored in a single top-level `/posts` collection. This global `posts` collection allows any user to easily query and view all public posts. Security rules are configured to enforce that while all authenticated users can read posts, only the original author (`authorId` must match `request.auth.uid`) can write, update, or delete their own posts. This avoids complex queries and ensures efficient, secure data access for a public feed.
